alert.note: Alert for Palo Pinto (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Tornado Warning issued May 11 at 11:47PM CDT until May 12 at 12:15AM CDT by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: The National Weather Service in Fort Worth has issued a * Tornado Warning for... Southwestern Palo Pinto County in north central Texas... * Until 1215 AM CDT. * At 1147 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located near Gordon, or 18 miles northeast of Ranger, moving northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Tornado and ping pong ball size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. * This dangerous storm will be near... Lake Palo Pinto around 1205 AM CDT. Other locations impacted by this tornadic thunderstorm include Lone Camp. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.50 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
